page.title: 17MUTHILL CIVIC TRUST.
page.content: In{1975}Muthill was classed as an Outstanding Conservation Area by the Historic Buildings Council for Scotland. The appearance of the two main roads (Drummond St and Willoughby St.)is little different from 200 years ago, although the houses have been modernised internally.A group of villagers formed the {Civic Trust}to preserve the appearance of the village.They check the plans for new buildings to make sure they fit in. They also renovated a burnt out house for a{Museum.}It shows old coins, photographs,weapons,antiques,clothes. Of the interesting photographs, one shows the fitting of an iron rim to a wooden cart wheel at the former Smithy near the Post Office.The other is of the mail coach coming up Willoughby St. on its way to the train South.
